gmx:name.gco:CharacterString: Feature catalog for Safety Roadside Rest Areas, California, 2015

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The point feature class of highway Safety Roadside Rest Areas in California
Internal feature number.
Feature geometry.
The unique ID in the Asset Management Inventory Database (AMI).
The full name of the rest area with the route direction
The location descripted in distance from the nearest named landmark.
City or place name
The rest area zip code.

A single-digit alpha code attached to the postmile as a prefix to indicate changes in the highway alignment: C - Commercial truck, D - Duplicate postmile at meandering county line, G - Reposting of duplicate postmile at end of a route, H - Realignment of D mileage, L - Overlap postmile, M - Realignment of R mileage, N - Realignment of M mileage, R - First realignment, S - Spur, T - Temporary connection.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Asset Management Inventory Database /Transportation System Network (TSN)

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Asset Management Inventory Database /Transportation System Network (TSN)

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: A numeric value based on the mileage measured from the beginning of a route or from a county line.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Asset Management Inventory Database/Transportation System Network (TSN)

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Asset Management Inventory Database/Transportation System Network (TSN)

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: An indication of alignment where the route alignments are independent. R = Right alignment, L = Left alignment.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Asset Management Inventory Database/Transportation System Network (TSN)

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Asset Management Inventory Database/Transportation System Network (TSN)

gfc:definition.gco:CharacterString: The latitude of the rest area location in Decimal Degrees.
The longitude of the rest area location in Decimal Degrees.
The URL of Caltrans Rest Areas website
Caltrans district number.
Caltrans county abbreviation
County name
Indicates the number of the route that the rest stop is located upon.
The unique identifier that will relate to the Caltrans HQ Landscape Architecture Safety Roadside Rest area database.
The name of the rest area.
The distance (in miles) from the nearest named landmark.
Indicates the traffic direction that a rest area exists along the route.
Indicates whether or not the rest area has restroom facilities.
Indicates whether the rest area has a water spigot/fountain.
An indication of whether or not the rest area has a picnic table on the premises.
Indicates whether or not the rest area has a pay phone for general use.
Indicates whether or not the facility is handi-cap accessible.
Indicates whether or not the facility has an area for RV parking.
Indicates whether or not there is a vending machine on the premises that sells food and/or beverages.
Indicates whether or not the rest area has a spot available to accommodate pets.
Indicates whether or not the rest area has an ashtray dump for cigarettes.
Indicates if the rest area is closed and the associated reasons for the closure.
